intro: Lysionotus omeiensis, commonly known as the Omei mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and is adapted to cool, humid climates. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, clustered blooms during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
